cards.flavor: She learned a tragic lesson that day: even the purest can be corrupted when the heart's emotions are twisted.
cards.name: Act of Treason
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.flavor:
"Approach from behind. That way, if it does charge, at least you aren't in front of it."
—Vivien Reid
cards.name: Aggressive Mammoth
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Other creatures you control have trample.

cards.flavor: As the ship approached, the jade totem rose high overhead. Power rippled. Eyes of stone glowed and crackled. Out hissed a breath of the world, and a windstorm came alive.
cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: Divining the future is easy when you hold the power to sway it.
cards.name: Anticipate
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: "As I desire, so it shall be." —Nicol Bolas
cards.name: Apex of Power
cards.text:
Exile the top seven cards of your library. Until end of turn, you may cast nonland cards exiled this way.
If this spell was cast from your hand, add ten mana of any one color.

cards.flavor: "My skill sharpens with each beat of my wings."
cards.name: Aven Wind Mage
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Aven Wind Mage gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "The trick to talking sense into Keldons is getting them to hold still."
cards.name: Befuddle
cards.text:
Target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"They are gentle herbivores, despite their size. Approach cautiously, and hum a tune to let them know you mean no harm."
—Vivien Reid
cards.name: Bogstomper

cards.flavor:
"Nicol Bolas destroyed my world. I owe it to Skalla to celebrate all life, no matter how dangerous."
—Vivien Reid
cards.name: Bristling Boar
cards.text: Bristling Boar can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.flavor: "I decide what stands in my way."
cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: As the hyperstormic generator crept past redline, a being emerged from the arc.
cards.name: Catalyst Elemental
cards.text: Sacrifice Catalyst Elemental: Add {R}{R}.

cards.flavor:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate
cards.name: Centaur Courser

cards.flavor: If you feel the ground quake, run. If you hear its bellow, flee. If you see its teeth, it's too late
cards.name: Colossal Dreadmaw
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor: "May the light shine through me to guide the lost."
cards.name: Daybreak Chaplain
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: A pit yawned open, a column of oily smoke arose, and a towering form hissed, "I accept this offering."
cards.name: Demon of Catastrophes
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Flying, trample

cards.flavor: The grave robbers were startled, for the door to the mausoleum was already open.
cards.name: Desecrated Tomb
cards.text: Whenever one or more creature cards leave your graveyard, create a 1/1 black Bat creature token with flying.

cards.flavor:
"At least this one still has arms and legs. Well, most of its legs."
—Enslow, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.name: Diregraf Ghoul
cards.text: Diregraf Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: It's pointless to hold on when you have nothing to hold on with.
cards.name: Disperse
cards.text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "The stars mark your destiny. May you accept the fate thus divulged."
cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.

cards.flavor: "These storied halls are under my protection."
cards.name: Dwarven Priest
cards.text: When Dwarven Priest enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.

cards.flavor: The collection didn't have room to expand, so the wizard improvised a solution.
cards.name: Dwindle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -6/-0.
When enchanted creature blocks, destroy it. (The attacking creature remains blocked.)

cards.flavor: "Some hid from the storm. I embraced it and learned its name."
cards.name: Electrify
cards.text: Electrify deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Elvish Rejuvenator
cards.text: Whenever Elvish Rejuvenator enters the battlefield, look at the top five cards of your library. You may put a land card from among them onto the battlefield tapped. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.flavor: Negotiations reached an abrupt conclusion.
cards.name: Fiery Finish
cards.text: Fiery Finish deals 7 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.
cards.name: Fire Elemental

cards.flavor: Entrepreneurs have attempted to sell the water, but to no avail. Whatever magic it contains disappears upon bottling.
cards.name: Fountain of Renewal
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 1 life.
{3}, Sacrifice Fountain of Renewal: Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Reel it in. No, wait! Throw it back!"
—Gertrude, deep-sea angler
cards.name: Frilled Sea Serpent
cards.text: {5}{U}{U}: Frilled Sea Serpent can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: Young artificers on Kaladesh let their imaginations run wild.
cards.name: Gearsmith Prodigy
cards.text: Gearsmith Prodigy gets +1/+0 as long as you control an artifact.

cards.flavor: They grow closer with every passing season.
cards.name: Ghastbark Twins
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Ghastbark Twins can block an additional creature each combat.

cards.flavor:
"After everything I've survived, it's hard to be frightened by anything anymore."
—Vivien Reid
cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor:
"Each tooth is the length of a horse, and new ones grow in every sixteen days. Let's get a closer look!"
—Vivien Reid
cards.name: Gigantosaurus

cards.flavor: "We can take 'em. You go first!"
cards.name: Goblin Instigator
cards.text: When Goblin Instigator enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token.

cards.flavor: Small words stoke large flames.
cards.name: Goblin Motivator
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.flavor: "I can hear the plunder calling. It asks for me by name."
cards.name: Grasping Scoundrel
cards.text: Grasping Scoundrel gets +1/+0 as long as it's attacking.

cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Once every seven years it flies on spectral wings over the moors of ancient battlefields.
cards.name: Gravewaker
cards.text:
Flying
{5}{B}{B}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: "I found a new toy. Wanna play?"
cards.name: Guttersnipe
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Guttersnipe deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.flavor: The clerics prayed for salvation. The soldiers prayed for victory. Both prayers were answered.
cards.name: Herald of Faith
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Herald of Faith attacks, you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor:
"Bring down a stag and fix its horns upon her head. This one hears the whispers."
—Chianul, at the weaving of Arel
cards.name: Highland Game
cards.text: When Highland Game dies, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Horizon Scholar
cards.text:
Flying
When Horizon Scholar enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: The bellow of minotaur always translates to "charge."
cards.name: Hostile Minotaur
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.flavor: "As soon as these intruders are gone, Zendikar will be my throne, my palace, and my playground."
cards.name: Infernal Judgment
cards.text: Exile target colorless creature. You gain life equal to its power.

cards.flavor: One who is marked by a demon in life is sure to be remembered as one in death.
cards.name: Infernal Scarring
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has "When this creature dies, draw a card."

cards.flavor: "Impossible! How could they overwhelm us? We had barricades, war elephants, … and they were barely a tenth of our number!" —General Avitora
cards.name: Inspired Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Only those who give the dragons the respect they deserve may bear our title."
cards.name: Kargan Dragonrider
cards.text: As long as you control a Dragon, Kargan Dragonrider has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: "Horse? Who needs a horse?"
cards.name: Knight of the Tusk
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor: "As long as my faith persists, so shall I."
cards.name: Knight's Pledge
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.flavor: A lich must consume mortal souls to feed its eternal life.
cards.name: Lich's Caress
cards.text: Destroy target creature. You gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: To wield lightning is to tame chaos.
cards.name: Lightning Strike
cards.text: Lightning Strike deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: As patient and generous as life, as harsh and merciless as nature.
cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.

cards.flavor: Loxodons are firm in stature and spirit. No matter the odds, they are always first into battle.
cards.name: Loxodon Line Breaker

cards.flavor: "Your part in this fight is done, vampire. Get used to your thirst."
cards.name: Luminous Bonds
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.flavor: A sharp axe solves most problems.
cards.name: Marauder's Axe
cards.text:
Equipped creature +2/+0.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."
cards.name: Mentor of the Meek
cards.text: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "I feel the presence of the God-Pharaoh in the Second Sun, and I rise upon its rays."
cards.name: Mighty Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Militia Bugler
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Militia Bugler enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card with power 2 or less from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.flavor: With matchless stealth, the River Heralds fought a running battle against the three enemy forces.
cards.name: Mist-Cloaked Herald
cards.text: Mist-Cloaked Herald can't be blocked.

cards.flavor: "It's not work if you enjoy it."
cards.name: Murder
cards.text: Destroy target creature.

cards.name: Nexus of Fate
cards.text:
Take an extra turn after this one.
If Nexus of Fate would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Nexus of Fate and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

cards.flavor:
"When the beast cloaks itself in the mighty oak, what good is a bow? When the oak wraps itself around the snarling beast, what good is a hatchet?"
—Dionus, elvish archdruid
cards.name: Oakenform
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

cards.flavor: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.
cards.name: Omenspeaker
cards.text: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: The ogres you know are nothing like the Onakke. Possessing both intellect and industry, they had brute strength without being brutish.
cards.name: Onakke Ogre

cards.flavor: The leonin of Oreskos are quick to take offense—not because they are thin-skinned but because they are always ready for a fight.
cards.name: Oreskos Swiftclaw

cards.flavor: Nicol Bolas would not rest until he was restored to his former glory.
cards.name: Patient Rebuilding
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard, then you draw a card for each land card put into that graveyard this way.

cards.flavor: A pegasus chooses its rider, bearing the worthy into the clouds and tossing all others to the ground.
cards.name: Pegasus Courser
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Pegasus Courser attacks, another target attacking creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Let nothing own the skies but the wind."
—Dejara, Giltwood druid
cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.flavor:
"You should have seen the look on both their faces."
—Morkamp, Lambholt innkeeper
cards.name: Rabid Bite
cards.text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.

cards.flavor: As the Cabal legions pushed into Shiv, they learned not to stand so close together.
cards.name: Radiating Lightning
cards.text: Radiating Lightning deals 3 damage to target player and 1 damage to each creature that player controls.

cards.flavor: "The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
cards.name: Recollect
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: The most holy treasures are kept far from unclean soil.
cards.name: Reliquary Tower
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
{T}: Add {C}.

cards.flavor: "A potion is no substitute for a skilled surgeon, but it will hold your bits in." —Torricks, battlefield medic
cards.name: Revitalize
cards.text:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "Safe passage requires only a simple answer to a simple question, traveler."
cards.name: Riddlemaster Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
When Riddlemaster Sphinx enters the battlefield, you may return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Thievery requires subtlety, from the beginning of the heist to the end.
cards.name: Rogue's Gloves
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Native to wide prairies and scrublands, falcons occasionally roost in dragon skeletons.
cards.name: Rustwing Falcon
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: The greatest treasure of the deep is an echo from above.
cards.name: Salvager of Secrets
cards.text: When Salvager of Secrets enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "The path of the stars is as reliable as the instruments that measure them."
cards.name: Scholar of Stars
cards.text: When Scholar of Stars enters the battlefield, if you control an artifact, draw a card.

cards.flavor: She watches over the city just as Serra watches over all.
cards.name: Serra's Guardian
cards.text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Other creatures you control have vigilance.

cards.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.
cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The tools of invention became the weapons of revolution.
cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: A pair of domesticated griffins escaped from captivity a century ago. Now the skies are filled with the songs of their descendants.
cards.name: Silverbeak Griffin
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor:
"When it comes to killing with precision, a soul is but a hindrance."
—Isareth the Awakener
cards.name: Skeleton Archer
cards.text: When Skeleton Archer enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: From the perpetual shadowsmoke that hung above the ship, a silent form emerged, lips curled with malice and anticipation.
cards.name: Skymarch Bloodletter
cards.text:
Flying
When Skymarch Bloodletter enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: The municipal senate makes extensive use of the thopters, mostly to gather dirt on rival senators.
cards.name: Skyscanner
cards.text:
Flying
When Skyscanner enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"I give them dreams so wondrous that they hesitate to return to the world of the conscious."
—Garild, merfolk mage
cards.name: Sleep
cards.text: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.

cards.flavor: The creation of new weapons demands the destruction of others.
cards.name: Smelt
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.
cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
"You have given all to your kingdom, dear knight. Serenity shall be your prize."
—Queen Lian
cards.name: Sovereign's Bite
cards.text: Target player loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: Fools believe that Kolaghan's brood follows lightning storms. The wise know that it is the other way around.
cards.name: Sparktongue Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Sparktongue Dragon enters the battlefield, you may pay {2}{R}. When you do, it deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: White as starlight on snow, it appears only on the eve of the winter solstice.
cards.name: Star-Crowned Stag
cards.text: Whenever Star-Crowned Stag attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.

cards.flavor: Imagine a thousand tiny mushrooms cropping up within your lungs.
cards.name: Strangling Spores
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Just as the sun rises at dawn and the days lengthen in the summer, the Sun Empire has awakened after long years of quiet.
cards.name: Sun Sentinel
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.flavor: To survive imminent doom, it sometimes takes a foolhardy soul who acts first and fears later.
cards.name: Sure Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Your death will be a balm, your passing a welcome revision, and all will sigh with peace to know of your demise."
cards.name: Take Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.flavor: The dead who wander beyond the safety of the city crave only to spread their curse.
cards.name: Tattered Mummy
cards.text: When Tattered Mummy dies, each opponent loses 2 life.

cards.flavor:
"Halana grew brambles to create a barricade around our camp, hoping that it would keep the wolves out. That was a mistake for which we almost paid dearly."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig
cards.name: Thornhide Wolves

cards.flavor: Tazeem's embrace is harsh, but for those that call it home, nothing else will do.
cards.name: Timber Gorge
cards.text:
Timber Gorge enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.

cards.flavor: The massive dominate through might. The tiny survive with guile. Beware the tiny who become massive.
cards.name: Titanic Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The Tolarian Academies embrace a tradition of study and research while discouraging the kinds of experiments that ruined the original island of Tolaria.
cards.name: Tolarian Scholar

cards.flavor: "Unwelcome thoughts crowd my mind. Are they my own madness, or the whispers of another?" —Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Tormenting Voice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card.
Draw two cards.

cards.flavor: Fblthp had always hated crowds.
cards.name: Totally Lost
cards.text: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: The sound of the trumpets lights a fire in the hearts of the bold and snuffs the courage of the cowardly.
cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Margaret has traveled with me to the end of the world and back."
—Hewen Frit, merchant
cards.name: Trusty Packbeast
cards.text: When Trusty Packbeast enters the battlefield, return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"Thread the torsos together with angel hair to ensure they will cooperate in battle."
—The Stitcher's Tome
cards.name: Two-headed Zombie
cards.text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.flavor: The cold slowed their movements until only their panicked eyeballs swiveled beneath the ice.
cards.name: Uncomfortable Chill
cards.text:
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "Wold you rather feel the edge of blade or the sharpness of my fangs?"
cards.name: Ursine Champion
cards.text: {5}{G}: Ursine Champion gets +3/+3 and becomes a Bear Berserker until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor:
"Your service shall be rewarded."
—Queen Lian
cards.name: Vampire Sovereign
cards.text:
Flying
When Vampire Sovereign enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Vivien Reid
cards.text:
+1: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a creature or land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
-3: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.
-8: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +2/+2 and have vigilance, trample, and indestructible."

cards.name: Vivien's Invocation
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. When a creature is put onto the battlefield this way, it deals damage equals to its power to target creature an opponent controls.

cards.flavor: Sometimes an eruption in Shiv produces something more dangerous than a mere river of molten rock.
cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.flavor:
"Feeding a normal army is a problem of logistics. With zombies, it is an asset. Feeding is why they fight. Feeding is why they are feared."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.name: Walking Corpse

cards.flavor: The seafloor is flecked with the bones of fools who dared sail into the mist.
cards.name: Wall of Mist
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

cards.flavor: Like all jungle plants, the vines must fight and claw for sunlight. Once their place is secured, they grow strong, sharp, and impenetrable.
cards.name: Wall of Vines
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Waterknot
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Waterknot enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
